contentJson: ["The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

contentJson: ["To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;

contentJson: ["To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;",{"noteId":0}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;

contentJson: ["To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.",{"noteId":1}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

contentJson: ["A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:

contentJson: ["To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.",{"noteId":2}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

contentJson: ["¶ The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.",{"noteId":3}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

contentJson: ["My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

contentJson: ["For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.",{"noteId":4}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

contentJson: ["¶ My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

contentJson: ["If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

contentJson: ["Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:

contentJson: ["We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

contentJson: ["Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:

contentJson: ["My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:

contentJson: ["For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

contentJson: ["Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.",{"noteId":5}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.

contentJson: ["And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.

contentJson: ["So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

contentJson: ["¶ Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:",{"noteId":6}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:

contentJson: ["She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,

contentJson: ["How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

contentJson: ["Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

contentJson: ["¶ Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;

contentJson: ["But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

contentJson: ["I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

contentJson: ["When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

contentJson: ["Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:

contentJson: ["For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD:

contentJson: ["They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.

contentJson: ["Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

contentJson: ["For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.",{"noteId":7}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.

contentJson: ["But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.

contentJson: ["My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

contentJson: ["So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;

contentJson: ["Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;",{"noteId":8}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;

contentJson: ["If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;

contentJson: ["Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.

contentJson: ["For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.

contentJson: ["He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

contentJson: ["He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

contentJson: ["Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.

contentJson: ["¶ When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

contentJson: ["Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

contentJson: ["To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;

contentJson: ["Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

contentJson: ["Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

contentJson: ["Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:

contentJson: ["To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;

contentJson: ["Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.

contentJson: ["For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

contentJson: ["None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

contentJson: ["That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.

contentJson: ["For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

contentJson: ["But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.",{"noteId":9}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.

contentJson: ["My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

contentJson: ["For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.",{"noteId":10}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

contentJson: ["Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

contentJson: ["So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.",{"noteId":11}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

contentJson: ["¶ Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

contentJson: ["In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

contentJson: ["¶ Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.

contentJson: ["It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.",{"noteId":12},{"noteId":13}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

contentJson: ["Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

contentJson: ["So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

contentJson: ["¶ My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:

contentJson: ["For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

contentJson: ["¶ Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.",{"noteId":14}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

contentJson: ["For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

contentJson: ["She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

contentJson: ["Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.

contentJson: ["Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

contentJson: ["She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.

contentJson: ["The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.",{"noteId":15}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

contentJson: ["By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

contentJson: ["¶ My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

contentJson: ["So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

contentJson: ["Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

contentJson: ["When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

contentJson: ["Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

contentJson: ["For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

contentJson: ["¶ Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.",{"noteId":16}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.

contentJson: ["Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

contentJson: ["Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.",{"noteId":17}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

contentJson: ["¶ Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

contentJson: ["¶ Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.",{"noteId":18}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

contentJson: ["For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.

contentJson: ["¶ The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

contentJson: ["Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

contentJson: ["The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.",{"noteId":19}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.

contentJson: ["Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.

contentJson: ["For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.

contentJson: ["For I was my father’s son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For I was my father’s son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.

contentJson: ["He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.

contentJson: ["Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

contentJson: ["Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.

contentJson: ["Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.

contentJson: ["Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

contentJson: ["She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.",{"noteId":20}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.

contentJson: ["Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.

contentJson: ["I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.

contentJson: ["When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

contentJson: ["Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.

contentJson: ["¶ Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.

contentJson: ["Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.

contentJson: ["For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.

contentJson: ["For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

contentJson: ["But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

contentJson: ["The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

contentJson: ["¶ My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

contentJson: ["Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.

contentJson: ["For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.",{"noteId":21}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

contentJson: ["¶ Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.",{"noteId":22}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.

contentJson: ["Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.",{"noteId":23}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.

contentJson: ["Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

contentJson: ["Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.",{"noteId":24}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.

contentJson: ["Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.

contentJson: ["My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:

contentJson: ["That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.

contentJson: ["¶ For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:",{"noteId":25}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:

contentJson: ["But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

contentJson: ["Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

contentJson: ["Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.

contentJson: ["Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

contentJson: ["Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

contentJson: ["Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:

contentJson: ["Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;",{"noteId":26}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;

contentJson: ["And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

contentJson: ["And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

contentJson: ["And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

contentJson: ["I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

contentJson: ["¶ Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

contentJson: ["Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.

contentJson: ["Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.

contentJson: ["Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.

contentJson: ["Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.",{"noteId":27},{"noteId":28}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

contentJson: ["And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

contentJson: ["For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.

contentJson: ["¶ His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.",{"noteId":29}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.

contentJson: ["He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.

contentJson: ["My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,

contentJson: ["Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.

contentJson: ["Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.",{"noteId":30}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.

contentJson: ["Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

contentJson: ["Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

contentJson: ["¶ Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

contentJson: ["Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,

contentJson: ["Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.

contentJson: ["How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

contentJson: ["Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

contentJson: ["So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.

contentJson: ["¶ A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.

contentJson: ["He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;

contentJson: ["Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.",{"noteId":31}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.

contentJson: ["Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.

contentJson: ["¶ These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:",{"noteId":32}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:

contentJson: ["A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,",{"noteId":33}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

contentJson: ["An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,

contentJson: ["A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.

contentJson: ["¶ My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

contentJson: ["Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.

contentJson: ["When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

contentJson: ["For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:",{"noteId":34}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:

contentJson: ["To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.",{"noteId":35}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

contentJson: ["Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.

contentJson: ["For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.",{"noteId":36}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.

contentJson: ["Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?

contentJson: ["Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?

contentJson: ["So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.

contentJson: ["Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

contentJson: ["But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

contentJson: ["But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.",{"noteId":37}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.

contentJson: ["A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

contentJson: ["For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

contentJson: ["He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.",{"noteId":38}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.

contentJson: ["My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

contentJson: ["Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

contentJson: ["Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.

contentJson: ["Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:

contentJson: ["That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.

contentJson: ["¶ For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

contentJson: ["And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,",{"noteId":39}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

contentJson: ["Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

contentJson: ["In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:",{"noteId":40}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

contentJson: ["And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

contentJson: ["(She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

contentJson: ["Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)

contentJson: ["So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,",{"noteId":41}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,

contentJson: ["I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.",{"noteId":42}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

contentJson: ["Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

contentJson: ["I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.

contentJson: ["I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

contentJson: ["Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

contentJson: ["For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:

contentJson: ["He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.",{"noteId":43},{"noteId":44}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.

contentJson: ["With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

contentJson: ["He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;",{"noteId":45}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

contentJson: ["Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.

contentJson: ["¶ Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

contentJson: ["Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

contentJson: ["For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.

contentJson: ["Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.

contentJson: ["Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?

contentJson: ["She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.

contentJson: ["She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.

contentJson: ["Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.

contentJson: ["O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.

contentJson: ["Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.

contentJson: ["For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.",{"noteId":46}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

contentJson: ["All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.",{"noteId":47}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.

contentJson: ["They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

contentJson: ["Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.

contentJson: ["For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.

contentJson: ["I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.",{"noteId":48}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

contentJson: ["The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

contentJson: ["Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.

contentJson: ["By me kings reign, and princes decree justice."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

contentJson: ["By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.

contentJson: ["I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.

contentJson: ["Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.

contentJson: ["My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

contentJson: ["I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:",{"noteId":49}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

contentJson: ["That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.

contentJson: ["The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

contentJson: ["I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.

contentJson: ["When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.

contentJson: ["Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:

contentJson: ["While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.",{"noteId":50},{"noteId":51}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.

contentJson: ["When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:",{"noteId":52}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:

contentJson: ["When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

contentJson: ["When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

contentJson: ["Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;

contentJson: ["Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.

contentJson: ["Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.

contentJson: ["Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.

contentJson: ["Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

contentJson: ["For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the LORD.",{"noteId":53}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the LORD.

contentJson: ["But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.

contentJson: ["Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:

contentJson: ["She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.",{"noteId":54}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.

contentJson: ["She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,

contentJson: ["Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

contentJson: ["Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.

contentJson: ["Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

contentJson: ["He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.

contentJson: ["Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.

contentJson: ["Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.

contentJson: ["The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.

contentJson: ["For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

contentJson: ["If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

contentJson: ["¶ A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.

contentJson: ["For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

contentJson: ["To call passengers who go right on their ways:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

contentJson: ["Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

contentJson: ["Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.",{"noteId":55}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

contentJson: ["But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.

contentJson: ["The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

contentJson: ["Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

contentJson: ["The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.",{"noteId":56}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.

text: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.
