text: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

contentJson: ["The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

contentJson: ["The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.

contentJson: ["Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

contentJson: ["He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

contentJson: ["Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

contentJson: ["For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.",{"noteId":172}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

contentJson: ["That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.",{"noteId":173}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

contentJson: ["Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

contentJson: ["That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?",{"noteId":174}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?

contentJson: ["Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

contentJson: ["For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

contentJson: ["Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

contentJson: ["Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

contentJson: ["Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

contentJson: ["If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

contentJson: ["Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.",{"noteId":175}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

contentJson: ["Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.",{"noteId":176}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.

contentJson: ["When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

contentJson: ["And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

contentJson: ["Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.

contentJson: ["Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

contentJson: ["Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.",{"noteId":177}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

contentJson: ["Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:

contentJson: ["For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

contentJson: ["The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

contentJson: ["Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

contentJson: ["Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:",{"noteId":178}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

contentJson: ["For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

contentJson: ["Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

contentJson: ["Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

contentJson: ["Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

contentJson: ["My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.",{"noteId":179}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

contentJson: ["Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

contentJson: ["Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.

contentJson: ["For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.",{"noteId":180}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

contentJson: ["Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.

contentJson: ["Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:",{"noteId":181}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

contentJson: ["For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

contentJson: ["Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

contentJson: ["Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

contentJson: ["The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

contentJson: ["Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.

contentJson: ["My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

contentJson: ["For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

contentJson: ["She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.",{"noteId":182}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

contentJson: ["Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

contentJson: ["They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

contentJson: ["Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

contentJson: ["At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.",{"noteId":183}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

contentJson: ["Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.

contentJson: ["Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.",{"noteId":184}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

contentJson: ["They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.",{"noteId":185}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.

contentJson: ["Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them.

contentJson: ["For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.

contentJson: ["Through wisdom is an house builded; and by understanding it is established:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Through wisdom is an house builded; and by understanding it is established:

contentJson: ["And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.

contentJson: ["A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.",{"noteId":186},{"noteId":187}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.

contentJson: ["For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety.

contentJson: ["Wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in the gate."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in the gate.

contentJson: ["He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person.

contentJson: ["The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men.

contentJson: ["If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.",{"noteId":188}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.

contentJson: ["If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death, and those that are ready to be slain;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death, and those that are ready to be slain;

contentJson: ["If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider it? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to every man according to his works?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider it? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to every man according to his works?

contentJson: ["My son, eat thou honey, because it is good; and the honeycomb, which is sweet to thy taste:",{"noteId":189}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, eat thou honey, because it is good; and the honeycomb, which is sweet to thy taste:

contentJson: ["So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.

contentJson: ["Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; spoil not his resting place:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; spoil not his resting place:

contentJson: ["For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.

contentJson: ["Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth:

contentJson: ["Lest the LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.",{"noteId":190}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Lest the LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.

contentJson: ["Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked;",{"noteId":191}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked;

contentJson: ["For there shall be no reward to the evil man; the candle of the wicked shall be put out.",{"noteId":192}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For there shall be no reward to the evil man; the candle of the wicked shall be put out.

contentJson: ["My son, fear thou the LORD and the king: and meddle not with them that are given to change:",{"noteId":193}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: My son, fear thou the LORD and the king: and meddle not with them that are given to change:

contentJson: ["For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?

contentJson: ["These things also belong to the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: These things also belong to the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.

contentJson: ["He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous; him shall the people curse, nations shall abhor him:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous; him shall the people curse, nations shall abhor him:

contentJson: ["But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.",{"noteId":194}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.

contentJson: ["Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer.",{"noteId":195}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer.

contentJson: ["Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house.

contentJson: ["Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.

contentJson: ["Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.

contentJson: ["I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;

contentJson: ["And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.

contentJson: ["Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction.",{"noteId":196}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction.

contentJson: ["Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

contentJson: ["So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.",{"noteId":197}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.

contentJson: ["These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

contentJson: ["It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

contentJson: ["The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.",{"noteId":198}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

contentJson: ["Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.

contentJson: ["Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

contentJson: ["Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:",{"noteId":199}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:

contentJson: ["For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.

contentJson: ["Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

contentJson: ["Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:",{"noteId":200}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:

contentJson: ["Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.

contentJson: ["A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.",{"noteId":201}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.

contentJson: ["As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

contentJson: ["As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

contentJson: ["Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.",{"noteId":202}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.

contentJson: ["By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

contentJson: ["Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

contentJson: ["Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour’s house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.",{"noteId":203},{"noteId":204}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour’s house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.

contentJson: ["A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.

contentJson: ["Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

contentJson: ["As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.

contentJson: ["If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:

contentJson: ["For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee.

contentJson: ["The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.",{"noteId":205}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.

contentJson: ["It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.

contentJson: ["As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.

contentJson: ["A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.

contentJson: ["It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.

contentJson: ["He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.

contentJson: ["As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

contentJson: ["As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

contentJson: ["A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.

contentJson: ["Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

contentJson: ["Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.",{"noteId":206}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

contentJson: ["He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.",{"noteId":207}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.

contentJson: ["The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.",{"noteId":208}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

contentJson: ["As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.",{"noteId":209}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version

contentJson: ["There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.

contentJson: ["The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:",{"noteId":259}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:

contentJson: ["The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.

contentJson: ["The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.",{"noteId":260}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

contentJson: ["There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:

contentJson: ["The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.",{"noteId":261}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.

contentJson: ["Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

contentJson: ["For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:

contentJson: ["For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;

contentJson: ["For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.

contentJson: ["There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:",{"noteId":262}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:

contentJson: ["The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;

contentJson: ["The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;

contentJson: ["The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;",{"noteId":263}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;

contentJson: ["The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces.

contentJson: ["There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:

contentJson: ["A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

contentJson: ["A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.",{"noteId":264}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.

contentJson: ["If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.

contentJson: ["Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.

contentJson: ["The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.

contentJson: ["What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?

contentJson: ["Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.

contentJson: ["It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:"]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:

contentJson: ["Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.",{"noteId":265},{"noteId":266}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.

contentJson: ["Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.",{"noteId":267}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.

contentJson: ["Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

contentJson: ["Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.",{"noteId":268}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

contentJson: ["Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.

contentJson: ["¶ Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: ¶ Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.

contentJson: ["The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.

contentJson: ["She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.

contentJson: ["She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

contentJson: ["She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar.

contentJson: ["She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

contentJson: ["She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.",{"noteId":269}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

contentJson: ["She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

contentJson: ["She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.",{"noteId":270}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.

contentJson: ["She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

contentJson: ["She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.",{"noteId":271}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

contentJson: ["She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.",{"noteId":272}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

contentJson: ["She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.

contentJson: ["Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

contentJson: ["She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

contentJson: ["Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.

contentJson: ["She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.

contentJson: ["She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

contentJson: ["Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.

contentJson: ["Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.",{"noteId":273}]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

contentJson: ["Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.

contentJson: ["Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates."]
name: King James (Authorized) Version
text: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.
